projectDesc.p: This project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_V01.xml file.

revisionDesc.change: creation of initial encoding of the inscription

div.p:
1
. . . namo stu ṣadvināyakāya . . . svastī śakavarṣātīta 861 bhadravādamāsa, tithi pañcamĭ kr̥ṣṇapakṣa, vā, pa, śu, vāra, Aśvinīnakṣatra, Aśvīdevatā, vi
ṣkambhayoga, Irikā divasani Ājñā śrī mahārāja rakai halu dyaḥ siṇḍok· śrī Īśānavikrama, tinaḍaḥ rakryān· mapatiḥ I halu dyaḥ sahasra Umiṅsor· I samga
t· kanuruhan· pūdā, kumonnakan· Ikaṁ lmaḥ varuk· ryy ālasantan· vatək· bavaṁ mapapan·, sīmān· rakryān· kabayān· Ibu rakryān· mapatiḥ I halu dyaḥ sahasra kvaiḥ
nya tampaḥ 13 bheda saṅkā riṁ pomahan· kəbuAn·-kəbuAn· pamli Iriya kā 12 dumuAl· Ikaṁ lmaḥ rāma ryy ālasantan· sapasug banuA, pratyekanikaṁ rā
ma manarima mās· vinkas· kaki vantil·, pastī, sukhamī, guru dr̥vyak·, kaḍaṅayan·, suji, rambay·, jikən·, lubhī, Apkan, maṇḍaraḥ, gusti Aṅkat·, panulisan· tambi, bhr̥tyaḥ,
bharalī, duvəg·, baryyuṁ, tuṅgəṁ, vulakan·, popoṁ, parujar· mañciṁ, tuhalas· varakas·, kabat·, bahu, khyāti, suraṅgaṇā, telā, puluḥ, bhujī, saṇḍak·, vakulan· ma
ndon·, maṇḍal· lālaṁ, Akajar kumīs·, ḍampal·, kuhal·, capil·, variga kāliḥ bakacak·, busta, saṁlā, tuha vəR̥ḥ dayī, cabil·, nāhan· kvaiḥnikanaṁ rāma manarima mā
s·, paknānikanaṁ lmaḥ An· sinīma, śīmā paṅurumbigyana rakryān· kabayān·, parṇnahanya svatantrā, tan· katamāna deniṁ patiḥ vahuta rāma, muAṁ saprakāraniṁ maṅilala dra
bya haji riṁ daṅū, miśra parāmiśrā vulu-vulu prakāra, paṅuraṁ, kriṁ, paḍam·, manimpiki, paraṇakan·, limus galauḥ, paṅaruhan·, taji, vatu tajam·, sukun·, halu varak·, ra
kadut·, pinilai, kataṅgaran·, tapa haji, Air haji, malandaṁ, L̥ca, L̥b-lab·, kalaṅkaṁ, kutak·, taṅkil· tr̥pan·, salvīt·, vatu valaṁ, pamaṇikan·, sikpān·, rumbān·, tiṅkəs·
viji kavaḥ, vilaṁ vanuA, tuha dagaṁ, juru guśali tuhān nambi, tuhān· huñjaman·, juru juḍi, juru jalir·, miśra hino, vli hapū, vli vaduṁ, vli tambaṁ, vli pañjut·, vli haR̥ṁ, pa
bisar·, palamak·, pakaluṅkuṁ, Urutan·, dampulan·, tpuṁ kavuṁ, suṁsuṁ paṅuraṁ, pasuk alas·, payuṅan·, pāṅinn-aṅin· sipad bilut·, puluṁ paḍi, skar tahun·, panrāṅa
n·, panusuḥ, hopan·, pahaliman·, kḍi, valyan·, vidu, sambal·, sumbul·, hulun· haji, pamr̥ṣi, sinaguha, vatak· I jro, Ityevamādi tan· tamā rikanaṁ śima pa
ṅurumbigyan· lmaḥ varuk· ryy ālasantan·, kevala rakryān· saṁ maśīma Ataḥ pramāṇā I saṁ sadrabya hajinya kabaiḥ, samaṅkana Ikanaṁ sukhaduḥkha kadyaṅgāniṁ mayaṁ tan· pa
vvaḥ, valū rumambat· riṁ natar·, vipati, vaṅkay· kābunan·, rāḥ kasavur iṁ dalan·, vāk·capala, hastacapala, dūhilatan·, hidu kasirat·, mamijillakan· turaḥniṁ kikir· ma
mūk· mamumpaṁ, lūdan·, tūtan·, ḍaṇḍa kuḍaṇḍa bhaṇḍihālādi, rakryān· saṁ maśīma parānani drabya-hajinya kabaiḥ, kunaṁ Ikanaṁ mañambul·, mañavriṁ, maṁlākha, maṅapu
s· maṅubar·, matarub·, maṅgula, maṁdyūn·, manūla vuṅkuḍu, maṁluruṁ, mapahaṅan·, magavai ruṅki, payuṁ vəlū, mopiḥ, Akajaṁ, Akisī, mamubut·, maṅanamanam·, manavaṁ,
2
manahəb· mamisaṇḍuṁ manuk· makala-kalā, rakryān· saṁ maśīma Ataḥ pramāṇā I dr̥bya hajinya kabaiḥ, samaṅkana Ikanaṁ masambyavahāra hana ṅkāna hinīṅhīṅan· kvaihanya Anuṁ
tan· knāna de saṁ maṅilala dr̥bya haji, pataṁ tuhān· Iṁ sasambyavahāra Iṁ saśīma, yan· paṅulaṁ kbo 20 kboAnya Iṁ satuhān· sapi 40 Iṁ satuhān· vḍus· 80 Iṁ satu
hān· Aṇḍaḥ satarub· Iṁ satuhān·, maṅaraḥ pataṁ tuhān·, maguluṅan· pataṁ pasaṁ, paḍahi tluṁ taṅkilan·, Uṇḍahagi ruAṁ tuhān·, paṇḍay· mās· ruAṁ guśali, paṇḍay· tamba
ga ruAṁ guśali, paṇḍay· vsi ruAṁ guśali, macadar· vvaluṁ pacadaran·, yāpvan· pinikul· dagaṅanya kadyaṅgāniṁ mabasana, masayaṁ, maṅavari makacapuri maṅuñjal· kapas· vuṅkudu, vsi
tambaga kāṅśa timaḥ vuyaḥ paḍat· lṅa bras· gula kusumbha, saprakāraniṁ dval· pinikul·, kalima bantal· pikul·pikulananya Iṁ satuhān·, Ikanaṁ samaṅkana tan· knāna de saṁ maṅi
lala dr̥bya haji, saparānanya sadeśānya, ndān· makmitana ya tuliy· maṅke luĪranya, yāpvan· L̥viḥ saṅkā rikanaṁ saṁ pahīṁ Iriya knāna sakaL̥viḥnya de saṁ maṅilala sodhāra haji ta
nn adhikāna, Irikaṁ kāla maṅaṅsəAkan· rakryān· kabayān· Ibu rakryān· mapatiḥ I halu dyaḥ sahasra pasak-pasak· I śrī mahārāja su 5 vḍihan· gañjar haji yu 1 I hino su 2 mā 8
vḍihan· jaro haji yu 1 rakryān· mapatiḥ I halu dyaḥ sahasra su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1 ragkryān· vka dyaḥ bālīśvara su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1 rakryān· sirikan· pu balyaṁ su 1 mā 4 vḍihan·
yu 1 samgat· kanuruhan· pūdā su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1 tiruAn· ḍapunta taritip· su 1 mā 4 vḍihan yu 1 vadihati pu dinakara su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1 Akudur· pu tunaṁ su 1 mā 4 vḍiha
n· yu 1, maṁhuri pu paṇḍamuAn· mā 10 vḍihan· yu 1 halaran· pu bhāmā 10 vḍihan· yu 1 pakubāṁ saṁ ralimus· mā 10 vḍihan· yu 1 vaḍiṅin· pu tīkṣṇa mā 10 vḍihan· yu 1 tuhā
n i vadihati 2 miramiraḥ saṁ sudānta, halaran· saṁ lbur poḥ mā 10 vḍihan· yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, tuhānn i makudur· 2 təpusən·, Ulahan mā 5 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, pa
ṅuraṁ I vadihati saṁ ravuṅū, Anuṅgū saṁ deva mā 5 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, paṅuraṁ I makudur· saṁ rakəvəl·, Anuṅgū saṁ baruṇa mā 5 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, karamānni
ra I vadihati Atuha raray· mā 10, karamānnira I makudur· Atuha raray· mā 10, saṁ hyaṁ kudur mā 10 vḍihan· yu 1 tuhānn iṁ pakaraṇān· makabehan· juru kanayakān·
I mahārāja pu kuṇḍū, juru vadvā rarai pu suriṁ, juru kalula pu tapa, kaṇḍamuhi ḍaṅ ācāryya nārāyaṇa, citralekha saṁ nidhi, parujar· I halu visāga, ḍapunta basu, I vka viridiḥ,
ḍapunta niścaya, I paṅkaja ḍapunta govinda, I kanuruhan· saṁ ramase, I tiruAn· samuḍan·saṁ sumuḍan·, saṁ brahmaśiva, su 1 mā 4 kinabaihannira, citralekha I mahārāja lakṣaṇa, baḍiva, kī
rti, mā 4 vḍihan· hlai 1, sovaṁ-sovaṁ, patiḥ juru kāliḥ vaśaḥ saṁ śabda, kuci saṁ makāra, mā 5 vḍihan· yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, parujarniṁ patiḥ vaśaḥ piṅsor hyaṁ saṁ pakudān· mā 2 ku 2
vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, parujarniṁ patiḥ kuci paskaran· saṁ caitya mā 2 ku 2 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, rakryān· bavaṁ mapapan· dyaḥ gula su 2 mā 8 vḍihan· yu 1, tuhānn iṁ bavaṁ
dyaḥ maluA, Amaṁ rakryān· bavaṁ pu bukəṁ mā 10 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, rakryān· vulat patiḥ dyaḥ ḍohol· vinaiḥ vḍihan· jaro haji hlai 1, samgat· si jana pupujut· vḍihan·
3
sə̄ṁ rāḥ hlai 1 təĀsan· dyaḥ toloboṁ Atəhər ataḥ maṁharap· babak· I bavaṁ vinaiḥ pasək-pasək· su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1, samgat· muṅgaṁ pu maṅubər· vanuA ri muṅgaṁ tuhān iṁ ka
nayakān· ri halu vḍihan· hlai 1 kakaran· pu munda vḍihan· hlai 1 dyaḥ ghoṣa Amasaṅakan· I rakryān· bavaṁ mapapan· dyaḥ gula vḍihan· hlai 1 dyaḥ pataL̥san· vatak halu vanuA
I tumurun· vḍihan· hlai 1 saṁ jula, partaya ri Air banuA vanuA I virikan· vḍihan· hlai 1 saṁ praśānta tuhānn iṁ kalula I kanuruhan· vanuA I taṅunan· vḍihan· hlai 1, patiḥ dyaḥ
bajra, dyaḥ kumo 2 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, patiḥ maṁharap· babak· I paḍaṁ I paṅkaja saṁ baruṇa mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1, patiḥ I lmaḥ tulis· saṁ kilipan· mā 2 vḍihan· yu 1, tu
mpuk· mā 1 vḍihan· hlai 1 dəAn· kāma patiḥ I paḍaṁ mā 2 vḍihan· hlai 1, rāvaṇa mā 1 vḍihan· hlai 1, bikər·, hujuṁ, juṁhur·, dəmə, gacəm·, ku 2 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-so
vaṁ, pnik· patiḥ I lmaḥ tulis· maṁharap· babak· vḍihan· hlai 1, candra, bhanū, bakaṭəl·, ḍaluṁ vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, patiḥ I bavaṁ manujendra vḍihan· hlai 1 Anak·nya ruA vinaiḥ ku
2 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, vahuta I mapapan· maṁharap· babak· caitra, Urak·, Arja, su 1 mā 4 kinabehanya vḍihan· yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, vahuta I mapapan· bandhu ramani rakā, buR̥ṁ, kuñjar·,
paradhīpa, baliba, śrayisinta, tahimbək·, parujar· jaluk·, sūṅan·, kulumā, baracaḥ, maṁḍampak·, vinkas· surupī, dhara, su 7 kinabaihanya vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ vahuta I pagə
ruyuṁ maṁharap· babak· bayad· su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1, vahuta I vsivsi maṁharap· babak· baiśākha su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1, rāma ryy ālasantan· saṁ dr̥vyak·, rambay·, sukhamī, cleṁ, vinaiḥ
vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ su 1 kinabehanya, rāma ri lmaḥ tulis· milu, kaki śila, pahəḥ, dhanemvi, kuludū, bandī vineḥ vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, rāma I skar bila, pəgeṁ, rāma ka
bayān· maṅambaḥ vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, rāma I L̥buḥ runtiṁ, kalaṁ susup· vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, rāma I paḍaṅan· vunyaṁ, tuha kalaṁ karuk· vḍihan· hle 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, rāma
I tirim· paṇḍai, tuha kalaṁ manaḥ vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, rāma Iṁ lāpan· rūpa, tuha kalaṁ kūrma vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, rāma I vulu taji kurul· vḍihan· hlai 1, vila ryy āla
santan· si piluk· vḍihan· hlai 1, paṅuraṁ balun· mā 1, krīṁ landəp· mā 1, makudur lumakvānusuk· ḍaṇḍər· mā 10 vḍihan· yu 1 sahopakaraṇa saṅkap· riṁ saji, vadihati lumakvānusu
k· harava mā 10 vḍihan· yu 1 sahopakaraṇa saṅkap· Iṁ saji, I tlasniṁ mavaiḥ pasak-pasak· muAṁ vḍihan· I sira kabaiḥ, pinarṇaḥ Ikaṁ saji I saṁ makudur· I sorniṁ vitāna ma
ṅārgha saṁ pinakaviku sumaṁskāra Ikaṁ təAs· susuk· muAṁ kulumpaṁ, maṁḍiri ta saṁ makudur· maṅañjali I saṁ hyaṁ təAs· maluṅguḥ I sor·niṁ vitāna māndəlan· pāda humaR̥pakan· saṁ
hyaṁ təAs· masiṅhal· vḍihan· yu 1 tumūt· saṁ vadihati, lumkas saṁ makudur maṅuyut· manətək· gulūniṁ hayam· linaṇḍəsakan· Iṁ kulumpaṁ mamantiṅakan· hantlū Iṁ vatu śima, ma
maṁmaṁ manapathe saminaṁmaṁnira daṅū I katguhakna saṁ hyaṁ śima, Indaḥ ta kita kamuṁ hyaṁ Iṁ śri haricandana Agasti mahāR̥ṣi, pūrba dakṣiṇa paścimottara, maddhya Ūrdhvamadhaḥ ravi śa
śi kṣiti jala pavana hutāśana yajamānākāśa dharma Ahorātri sandhyā hr̥daya, yakṣa rākṣasa piśāca pretāsura garuḍa gandharba, catvāri lokapāla yama baruṇa
kuvera vāsava, muAṁ putra devatā pañcakuśika nandīśvara mahākāla maṣadvināyaka nāgarājā durgā devī, caturaśra Ananta surendra, Anakta hyaṁ kālamr̥tyu gaṇa bhūta, kita pra
4
siddha maṁrakṣa kaḍatvan· śrī mahārāja I mḍaṁ Iṁ bhūmi matarām· kita Umilu manarīra Umasuk iṁ sarbaśarīra kita sakala sākṣībhūta tumon· madoḥ lavan· mapaṜ Iṁ rahina riṁ vṅi At· ḍəṅəĀkan· ta Ikeṁ sa
maya śapatha sumpaḥ pamaṁmaṁ mami ri kita hiyaṁ kabaiḥ yāvat· Ikaṁṅ vaṁ durācāra tan māgam· tan makmit· Irikeṁ śapatha sinrahakan· saṁ vahuta hyaṁ kudur· hadyan hulun· matuha raray· lakilaki va
dvan· viku gr̥hastha muAṁ patiḥ vahuta rāma, Asiṁ Umulah-ulaḥ Ikeṁ lmaḥ varuk· ryy ālasantan· śīma paṅurumbigyan· Inarpaṇakan· śrī mahārāja I rakryān· kabayān· Ibu rakryān· mapatiḥ ri halu,
dyaḥ sahasra I dlāhaniṁ dlāha babata ta ya ṅuniveḥ yan· davuta saṁ hyaṁ vatu śīma tasmāt· kabvataknanya patyanantā ya kamuṁ hyaṁ deyantāt patī ya tatt anoliha I vuntat· tat tiṁhala I likuR̥n·
taruṁ riṅ adəgan· tampyal· I viraṅan· Uvahi I tṅanan· tutuḥ tuṇḍunya blaḥ kapālanya, sbitakan· vtaṅnya rantan· Ususnya vətvakan· ḍalmanya ḍuḍuk=hatinya, təhər· pəpəddakan· vkassakan· prāṇāntika, ya
n· para riṅ alas· paṅanann iṁ moṁ patukann iṁ Ulā, puliraknaniṁ devamanyuḥ yan· para riṁ tgal· Alapann iṁ glap· sampalann iṁ rākṣasa paṅananniṁ vvīl· si pamuṅvan·, tamolaḥ ya ri sthānanya sarbaroga ruma
ñca ya, Araḥ ta kita kamuṁ hyaṁ kuśika garga metrī kuruṣya pātāñjala suvuk· lor· suvuk kidul· kulvan· vetan· bvaṅakan· riṅ ākāśa salambitakan· Iṁ hyaṁ kabaiḥ tibākan· Iṁ mahāsamudra
klammakan· Iṁ ḍavuhan· Alapan· saṁ hyaṁ jalamm er· dudutanniṁ tuviran· saṅhapann iṁ vuhaya, ṅkānan· matya Ikaṁṅ vaṁ Anyāya luməbur· Ikeṁ śīma paṅurumbigyan· ryy ālasantan· Upadravā riṁ devata ka
baiḥ bhraṣṭā liputanniṁ ḍhīra muliha Iṁ kanaraka, tibākan· riṁ mahārorava klān de saṁ yamabala, palūn de saṁ kiṅkara piṁpitu Ata yan· bimbān· pāpā Ata ya saṁsārā sajīvakāla salvīrniṁ duḥlkha paṅgu
hanya sarūpaniṁ lara hiḍəpənya sakelikniṁ maṁjanma dadyananya Avūka tan· təmuAṁ śama, vkassakan· havu kerir· maṅkanātmahananikaṁṅ vaṁ Anyāya luməbur· Ikaṁ śīma paṅurumbigyan· ryy ālasantan·,
I tlas saṁ makudur maṅuyut· masalin· sira kabaiḥ kapva maluṅguḥ Iṁ tkan· pasək· tumut· krama saṁ hana riṁ kon· patiḥ vahuta rāma kabayān· muAṁ rāma təpi siriṁ kulapatī punta matuha rarai, la
ki-laki vadvan· kaniṣṭhamaddhyamottama tan· hana kāntun· Ilu manaḍaḥ riṁ pkan· ryy ālasantan· kinuran·kuran· InaṁsəAn· skul· dāndānan· hinirusan· klakla Ambil-ambil· kasyan· litlit· tlu sa
raṇak· saṅasaṅān· haryyas· rumbarumbaḥ kuluban· tetis· tumpuk·tumpuk· ḍeṁ hañaṁ ḍeṁ hasin· kakap· huraṁ, bijañjan· kaḍivas· kavan· laya-layar· hala-hala hantlū Ina
risuṇḍa Atak· pāhan· piṇḍa limas· Iṁ saron· saṅ abheda saṅkeṅ ivak·, kvaiḥnikaṁ kbo pinaṅan· 3 Ikaṁ saviji praṁ paṁpaṁ pinaṅan· taṇḍa rakryān· muAṁ patiḥ vahuta Ikaṁ 2 pinaṅan·
kinabehan· de taṇḍa rakryān· muAṁ patiḥ vahuta rāma, kidaṁ 3 coloeleṁ 1 haṅsa 1 pinaṅan· kinabehan· Aṅinum· siddhu, tvak· kilaṁ pintlu sovaṁ vinuvuhan· tambul· Inañjapan· kuravu ku
rima, hasam· dva-dval· madulur· malariḥ Umaṁsə̄ taṁ jənu skar· Anabəḥ ta saṁ matuvuṁ maṁḍiri rakai vulat patiḥ samgat· sijana saṁ tuhān· I halu patiḥ vahuta rāma, Anambaḥ humarap· I sārah-araḥ
śrī mahārāja, muAṁ rakryān mapatiḥ kamnā sira maṅigla, tuvuṁ buṁkuk· gaṇḍiṁ Iniglakannira, tlas nira maṅigəl· maluṅguḥ sira muvaḥ vinuvuhan· tambul· linarihan· piṇḍuA sovaṁ Umaṁsə̄ taṁ baṁlus· lina
rihan· muvaḥ Atəhir· masavuṅan· manaṅgap· tapukan· maṅaran· kampallan· vinaiḥ mā 2 mabañol· maṅaran· paṅinaṅan· vḍihan· hlai 1 si taratakan· ku 2 vidu maṅaran· vāhu vi
naiḥ mā 2 vḍihan· hlai 1 I tlasniṁ manonton· men·men· muliḥ sira kabaiḥ Irikaṁ vṅi manaṅgap· taṁ rakryān· vayaṁ maṅaran· si kapuluṅan·, vinaiḥ mā 2 vḍihan· hlai 1 nāhan· kramanikaṁ
susukan· śima paṅurumbigyan· ryy ālasantan· tkap· rakryān· kabayān· I vruha saṁ sādhujana kabaiḥ I pagəḥ saṁ hyaṁ śīma likhitapātra saṁ kīrti citralekha I mahārāja . . . . .

app.note: In other inscriptions we find tulis in this context.
Corr. sapahīṁ? sa-kaləvih? or noun from aṅaləvihakən?
One expects yu 1 I rakryān·. Note the absence of the preposition also in following entries in the list.
This is the expected reading (compare with Sobhamerta 4v6). The anusvāra is irregularly shaped.
What remains visible of the damaged akṣara assumed by W to be ra does not seem to agree with the akṣara ra, but I see no other possibility.
Perhaps the scribe intended and wrote vilaṁ (cf. vilaṁ vanua in 1r11)?

Wibowo reads a punctuation sign after this word, but I cannot see it on the photo of the plate, which admittedly is a bit worn here. Its presence is possible, but not necessary; some contemporary inscriptions punctuate the text here in this formula, while others do not.
See correction babakan proposed by Trigangga (, 23, 41, Linggasuntan face C, line 32 ) and XLVI or Anjukladang, back, last line.
See correction dalam er Trigangga (, 23, 43). Same error in Paraḍah(XLVIII), back l. 34? See also Rukam II, l. 18. The form dalam air is found in CII b, l. 11.

The opinion expressed in OJED’s note s.v. phīra is perhaps to be rejected, for dhīra makes fine sense if taken as ‘ocean’. The akṣaras ph and ḍ/ḍh are always easily confused, to Zoetmulder should not have simply accepted ‘that phira occurs six times’ based on published editions.

div.p: Homage to the six Vināyakas! Hail! Elapsed Śaka year 861, month of Bhadrapada, fifth day of the waning fortnight, Vās, Pahiṅ, Friday 6 Sept. 939, lunar mansion Aśvinī, deity Aśvī, conjunction Viṣkambha. That was the day that the order of his majesty the king Rakai Halu Dyah Siṇḍok Śrī Īśānavikrama, received by the honorable minister of Halu Day Sahasra, descended to the officiant of Kanuruhan Pu Udā, instructing that the varuk land at Ālasantan, district of Bavaṅ Mapapan, be made the freehold of the honorable elder, mother of the honorable minister of Halu, Dyah Sahasra.

Its total: 13 tampah, in addition to the housing-premises and orchards, the price for them being 12 kāṭi. The headmen of Ālasantan together with the inhabitants of the village sold the land. Every headman received gold: the Vinəkas Elder of Vantil, Pastī, Sukhamī, the teacher Dṛvyak, Kaḍaṅayan, embroidery, luxuriant, Jikən, Lubhī, market seller, Maṇḍarah, gusti aṅkat, scribe of tambi, servant of the goddess, duvəg (Bal.: clever), baryuṅ, tuṅgə, well, popoṅ, spokesman fishing, forester, varakas, kabat, Khyāti, Suraṅgaṇā, Telā, Puluh, Bhujī, Saṇḍak, Vakulan Mandon, Maṇḍal Lālaṅ, the Makajar named Kumīs, Ḍampal, Kuhal, Capil, the two Varigas Bakacak, Busta, Saṅlā, the Tuha Vərəh named Dayī and Cabil. Such was the total of the headmen receiving gold.

The purpose of the land would be to be made a freehold. It would be a Paṅurumbigyan freehold for the honorable elder. Its status would be independent. It should not be entered as before by the minister, the Wahuta, the headmen, and all types of enjoyers of royal dues: - miśra parāmiśrā - vuluvulu prakāra - paṅuraṅ - kriṅ - paḍam - manimpiki - paraṇakan - limus galuḥ - paṅaruhan - taji, - vatu tajam - sukun - halu varak - rakadut - pinilai - kataṅgaran - tapa haji - air haji - malandaṅ - ləca, - ləblāb - kalaṅkaṅ - kutak - taṅkil tr̥pan - salvīt - vatu palaṅ - pamaṇikan - sikpān· - rumbān - tiṅkəs - viji kavaḥ, - vilaṅ vanua - tuha dagaṁ, juru guśali tuhān nambi, tuhān· huñjaman·, juru juḍi, juru jalir·, - miśra hino, - vli hapū, vli vaduṁ, vli tambaṁ, vli pañjut·, vli harəṁ, - pabisar·, - palamak·, - pakaluṅkuṅ - urutan: - dampulan: - tpuṅ kavuṅ: - suṅsuṅ paṅuraṅ :receiving Paṅuraṅ - pasuk alas: forest dwellers - payuṅan: - pāṅinnaṅin: - sipad bilut: - puluṅ paḍi: paddy collectors? - skar tahun: ‘tribute’? - panrāṅan - panusuh - hopan: - pahaliman: mahout - kḍi: eunuch - valyan: healer - vidu: actor - sambal, sumbul: - hulun haji: - pamr̥ṣi: - sinaguha: The internal groups vatak i jro, etc., shall not enter into the Paṅurumbigyan freehold of the Varuk land at Ālasantan.

Only the lord founder of the freehold herself shall have authority over all its royal dues, as also the fines for crimes sukhaduḥkha such as - mayaṅ tan pavvah: palm flower that does not bear fruit - valū rumambat riṅ natar: gourd that grows along the ground - vipati vaṅkay kābunan: disaster of a bedewed corpse - rāh kasavur iṅ dalan: blood scattered on the street - vākcapala: insulting - hastacapala: beating - dūhilatan: accusing - hidu kasirat: spitting - mamijillākan turahniṅ kikir: drawing sharp weapons - mamūk: running amok / Bal. mūk ‘melanggar’. - mamumpaṅ: some form of mistreatment of women; rape? - lūdan: ??? - tūtan: ??? - ḍaṇḍa kuḍaṇḍa: ‘pukul memukul’ - bhaṇḍihālādi: ??? The lord who shall establish the freehold shall be the destination of all its royal dues.

As for those who - mañambul: to paint black - mañavriṅ: to make muslin - maṁlākha: to dye red - maṅapus: to twist ropes - maṅubar: to dye red - matarub: to make sheds - maṅgula: to make sugar - maṅdyūn: to make pots - manūla vuṅkudu: to stake mengkudu root - maṅluruṅ: to make castor-oil - mapahaṅan: to dye with pahaṅan - magavai ruṅki, payuṅ vəlū: to make baskets, round (?) parasols - mopih: to work upih - akajaṅ: to make awnings - akisī: to make basket works - mamubut: to produce turnery - maṅanam-anam: to plait - manavaṅ: to catch in a net - manahəb: ??? - mamisaṇḍuṅ manuk: to catch birds in a snare - makala-kalā: ??? Only the lord founder of the freehold herself shall have authority over all their royal dues.

Likewise those who are here engaging in trade are restricted. The number of those not subjected to the enjoyers of royal dues is four tradesman of the same trade per freehold. If they buy buffaloes, the share of buffaloes is 20 per tradesman; 40 cattle per tradesman; 80 sheep per tradesman; one flock/shelter of ducks per tradesman; silver-smiths, four masters; those who drive ox-carts, four yokes; drums, three places to play (make?) them; carpenters, two tradesman; goldsmiths, two smithies; coppersmiths, two smithies; ironsmiths, two smithies; cadar-clothmakers, eight cadar-clothmaking places. If their wares are carried with carrying-poles — such as cloth vendors, tinkers vendors of copper utensils, condiment sellers, fence makers, transporters of cotton, mengkudu, iron, copper, brass, tin, salt blocks, sesame, uncooked rice, sugar, safflower (seeds?) — all types of wares that are carred with poles: altogether there will be five carrying-pole loads per tradesman. Those who are in conformity with that will not be subjected to the enjoyers of royal dues, wherever those traders might go, whatever may be there origin. However, they should keep a document to that effect. If their trade is more than the limit imposed on them, they will be subjected in accordance with the surplus to the enjoyers of one royal share sa-uddhāra. It will not be exceeded.

After giving the gifts with cloth to all of them, the offerings for the Makudur were placed below the canopy. The one serving as priest poured water to purify the ‘heart’ for piercing and the kulumpaṅ stone. The Makudur arises bringing sembah to the holy ‘heart’ and sits below the canopy, having his feet as support (i.e. knelt), facing the holy ‘heart’, wearing as siṅhəl 1 set of cloth. The Vadihati follows. The Makudur begins to uyut, and cleaves the neck of a chicken, using the kulumpaṅ-stone as underlay, and bashes an egg on the sīma stone, prononouncing admonition and imprecation adressed to all those who are customarily admonished so that the holy freehold will be respected:
tatkāla rakarayān i garuṁ tumurun ājñānira: note the occurrence of a very similar sentences in the Palebuhan charter.
First edited by Wibowo (). Re-edited here by Arlo Griffiths from photographs Nigel Bullough.
